reviews.review_msg: Bernd is so dorky and lovable :) Not the most outstanding professor I've ever had, but I also have 0 complaints.

Great prof, always available for extra help definetly recommend him for any class at any level.  Only downside that he has is that he writes his notes extremely fast so its hard to really absorb material in lecture, all exams are very fair
One of the best profs and classes ever. Actually maybe the best.
Dr. Trottier is an awesome prof. He'll explain away any confusion, even if it takes a while.
He was the reason I took the course.  He want you to understand and learn
Great lectures. He's available to help if you have any questions. Assignments and tests definitely aren't easy but there are no 'filler' homework questions, they all teach you something.

Can explain physics very clearly and lectures are easy to follow and has lovely english accent which makes him sound even smarter. His assignments are long but not too difficult. Same with tests, not too hard but time will be an issue.  Overall very fun and interesting course. Would recommend.

Had him in Spring '05. Great course. I learned more about quantum mechanics from this course than I ever did in CHEM 260. Only downside is he just reads the Powerpoints word for word off the projector screen (although they're very nice and organized).
Great teacher, makes the lectures entertianing

He has office hours most of the time when he is not teaching.  Helpful tutorials.  Carefully designed assignments & tests.  Caring and open to suggestions.  But his PDF notes aren't that organized, though.  He just types in his speech word for word.

probably first class he's ever taught.  tries really hard but doesn't explain things well.  midterm straight out of lecture notes and assignments; few questions make you think on your own. lectures exactly same as text.helpful and receptive to comments.

Great teacher who knows how to maximize the advantages afforded by online delivery. Course is asynchronous with great lecture material that is a mix of text, video, and web-based demos. Homework and exams are closely coupled with lecture, which promote good understanding of lecture knowledge. Enthusiastic and energetic which affect students too.

Poor instructor that have zero capability to teach. You will often see her avoid a question by providing some sort of vague answer to it (even though she claim to be an expert). I think it is just better for her to do her research work than to teach. Do yourself a favour and avoid this person at all cost!

When you ask her a question, she typically likes to evade it for some reason or she gives a really vague answer. And some of the comments as noted is true like where she tried to implement a change in the overall passing of the course in the middle of the semester LOL. Wish she wasn't the one teaching the course, honestly.

Never met a prof like her that is so unprofessional. She tried to change the course grading system in the middle of the semester by saying students have to pass the final to pass the course. She also told the TA not to go over practice problems. Can't believe such a prof exists. Just don't take her course, guys.

Stay away from this professor unless you want to self-learn. Textbook is pretty useless and prof generally doesn't give the best responses to students' questions (nor does she care). No office hours were offered so really you are left on your own. Again, she only has time for her research work and not for students.
